tgX3aM09WUmF3RvBdiUFmA.text: Nice deco, light, airy and more modern country than urban atmosphere, good vibe in the place, especially after work when the place is really buzzing with people drinking a pint or two with colleagues. There are not many places to go for a drink in the area so this is certainly a popular one. The restaurant, which I have tried twice now, is highly disappointing: short and uninspiring menu, poor execution, not very tasting or enticing plates. Hopefully someone will hear this and work on upgrading the kitchen as with the location and space they have, they ought to do better. Note that there is a small terrasse at the back.

d5PW39coq-pouhExlbXEyA.text: Great Place for after work drinks, light, open, with a good outside space to hang in the sun with your pint and have a chat. The food is good, especially for lunch. The staff is nice, sometimes a bit slow, but hey, you shouldn't be in a hurry here.

LQnPWUxGkH9GYZACd2bQ8A.text: it's a gastro pub and that's about it really, the food is good but expensive and some of the staff are what customer service should be all about It's also one of the few places in the area you can get sky sports so can be ok for the football but they don't tend to want to put the sound on which is annoying. Roasts are good and it isn't as rammed on a Sunday, the garden and outside are good in the summer too, loads of spce to hang about and soak in the rays!

f4vg-IGDFbu_skHQauGGOg.text: The Phoenix is a great place for a group of friends to meet on a Sunday which we've done for various birthdays. They'll take bookings for quite large tables. A reasonably recent refurbishment has turned it from a comfy, slightly tatty pub into a smart gastropub although the food is more traditional pubgrub than gastropub and better value as a result. I had a very good homemade burger once and am looking forward to seeing what's on the menu when a group of us go again in early December. Worth a visit.

7Nb8QujmLewM9no2QtS2jg.text: Recently refurbished pub, with a clean fresh makeover. Serving good food with a good wine list as well as choice of bar drinks. Good food, which some may say is expensively priced. Can get overly busy and is difficult to get served at the bar. Good pub in the summer with lots of outside space. Close to Victoria train station.

AJCAXj-dpxralgWa-58BOQ.text: Considering there is very little to choose from in Victoria this place is actually pretty good all things considered. It's pretty standard gastro pub fare, the menu isn't massive so there wasn't much to choose from. I took a client there for lucnh. He had the bangers and mash which he didn't think was that nice. I opted for the seabass which was perfectly well cooked, just nothing amazing. I thought the service was just ok, they seemed to be understaffed and busy. I would go back, simply because it's one of the better places in Victoria. I've had better, but I've also had a lot worse.

0kLSpL75JZoZfUggTDLIZQ.text: Pleasant but pricey gastropub in Victoria, with a decent lunch menu and solid selection of ales. The Phoenix is nice and light, airy place, and the fact that the heating was broken added to the effect the other day. However, I kept my coat on and enjoyed the (slightly tough) minute steak, and even more so the hand cut chips, which are excellent - the best I've had in a pub. It's not cheap but the service is top notch and the Discovery was on form

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom

WruDWXpA_w1rgTRwRtYksw.text: There's something about the main bar area-maybe the height of the ceiling?-that made this an ideal pub for happy hour. Good vegetarian choices, as well.

xzMSqsJJM-Dk83C6MG_T9Q.text: Came here for food in the Saturday of jubilee weekend. Good crowd, but not crazy busy. Food was excellent and staff helpful. Good wine too, so recommended!

LIim2McYmPb4Ekc4X-K7AA.text: I can only speak for the bar bit, which was indeed perfectly alright.  Nothing more than that though.  The location is its main selling point - e.g not a wealth of perfectly alright bars round here.An uninspiring but ok range of beer and cider on tapModern, young professional decor including big photographic prints of peppers and tomatoes.When I went there with a group at 9pm on a weekday, the place was full of people around my age (25-30) who evidently earn a lot more than me and bother to iron their clothes.  The dog in our group was allowed in, which I thought was pretty cool.

GCwSY5xCzEC84YAfY6ibdg.text: The good news about the Phoenix is it's the best pub in the area for food. The bad news is this is somewhat akin to saying that Whitechapel is the best place to get yourself murdered if you've a penchant for ghoulish crepuscular wanderings.Victoria is not an area gastronomically blessed lets face it and given the limitations of getting something edible at all the Phoenix suddenly takes on a rather better lustre than if it had been in say Shoreditch or Islington.On to the review. The food is rather hit and miss, but then friday lunch times can get very busy. The burgers are decent but vary between too pink and too burnt, a honeyed duck was sickly but I've had a lovely venison stew there.Beer is excellent with a guest ale or two usually present and lagers crisp and clean. Try and get the French waitress downstairs (not a euphemism), she's quick and charming, but there is a comedy value with some of the other waiting staff who specialise in a school of service that fits somewhere in between surly and rude; I personally think it's part of the reason I keep going back.

kTSYGZKxVazM1Mg_1czomw.text: Husband and I stopped into the Phoenix for a late lunch after touring the Bloomsbury area all day. Wanting to make our way south to walk by the bigger tourist sites, we found the Yelp reviews for the Phoenix encouraging as I desperately wanted some fish and chips. Gosh, what a cute room! There was an older couple reading papers on couches by a fireplace, office folk chatting over a butcher block table, brightly colored pennants trimming the ceiling. We had the friendly French waitress mentioned in other reviews, who humored our request to pour us something local. My beer and fish were very good. Husband had the 3 course lunch deal (salad, soup, brownie)--also delicious. We were more than ready to stroll past Buckingham and Parliament after that warm atmosphere and food.

nCjB5duFkqype7vKQQEmQA.text: Had lunch the other day in the beautifully sunny upstairs room. Was very nice--the food was lovely, the wine was okay and the light was excellent. Service was ehh but not actually bad. Just a little stupid. Waitress who delivers a couple of chocolate mousses "Do you want some spoons with that?" Uh, yeah, that or a feedbag, because I'm going to get it into my face one way or another.

mlt8csQbkVNpVJcde8kdAw.text: I have nothing but good things to say about The Phoenix. We recently had our company Christmas party here and it was absolutely fantastic. Having never been before and given the task of booking a place near Hyde Park (new to the job and the city), I was a bit worried about how it would be.The room we reserved was awesome. Upstairs, away from the noisy crowd at the bar downstairs, with a huge dining table and a nice Christmas tree in the corner. We were waited on hand and foot. The food was delish. They even let us plug in my ipod to play Christmas music through the speakers.Just a great night had by all, with all the credit going to the Phoenix and their staff.

6wDApJszRX6--94h9_52GQ.text: The Pheonix is ideal for post-work drinks, and as a result it is always busy, brimming with local employees from one company or another. This sometimes means that the clientel can be a little on the not particularly friendly side, but if you're there with your own group, that shouldn't be a problem. It is, as a result, slightly on the expensive side, but this can be overlooked in the summer when a chilled pint outside is a must. One of the better pubs in the area, The Pheonix has a good range of beers and wines, and certainly enough to keep you there til closing time. There's also a beer garden which has heaters if you want to brave the chill of a winter's evening in the open air. The staff are friendly, if not a little too relaxed when the bar's busy, and this helps to give the pub a warm atmosphere at the end of a long hard working day.

q-pHBOxTgyp4EB6ifbGDXg.text: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at The Phoenix when we visited London a couple of weeks ago.  We had been trying to find a place for lunch and visited a nearby restaurant, only to be totally ignored while we waited for 10 minutes.  We left and walked by The Phoenix.  We thought we would try it, and we were so happy that we did.  First, it was air conditioned (we were there during the heat wave), so that was very welcome.  Second, it was not busy at all, so the employee was able to pay attention to the tables that were there.  He was very friendly and spent time with us, giving us directions to Buckingham Palace and advice about traveling in London.  He went from table to table, spending time with every customer.  He was very sweet, and if we lived there, we would visit again in a heartbeat (for lunch, that is).  I don't know if we would like a large dinner crowd.  The food was also pretty good.  My husband got the fish and chips (how can someone visit England and not get fish and chips?) and he really enjoyed them.  I got a vegetarian burger and was pleasantly surprised with the yummy taste.  The chips (fries for us Americans) were also very good.  They were served with barbecue sauce, and I actually enjoyed that.

8Qgw4TGwSPKw76QQBEhm7g.text: This recently refurbished pub is nothing special as such, but if you live locally it's a good place to go for a few pints with friends. Maybe place some darts, watch some sport or have a meal. Everything is pretty value for money, which is good considering its location. As mentioned, can seem like a bit of a tatty place when you visit, but it's got a good atmosphere.As you have your drink you can also revel at the fact that Buckingham Palace is just around the corner!

BwUHQx_ohNUIGGaXixnjhQ.text: Had lunch here this week. Mainly suits but disappointing club sandwich let an otherwise first class pub down. Go for the fat chips they're great. Service was attentive.

eoIkczEQJ3uz2Zd9t2NRLA.text: Decent Pub, nice pub food for lunch. My burger recently was nicely done. As it is close to the Qype London office, I would like to go there more often. However, it is often really really crowded at lunch time. Therefore I recently started to avoid it. Need to check it out for a beer after work, though.

Z303T0QlNKvn2rdbo9v_JA.text: Great atmosphere, good drinks, nice staff.Gets pretty packed in the evening's, but you can stand outside or go in the garden in the summer which is nice (pretty quiet road). Have been several times with work, and it's great that it's so near the station!

iWDSoFEfWRDstMfkNykFuw.text: Hmmm. I think I'm pretty torn about this pub. For a start, it's not really the pub's fault that we were delayed and only had about 40 minutes to eat and order. And they were really busy. But it did make lunch a bit of a pain when we were told out food would be half an hour. The staff were really polite though and got us a table quickly and pushed our order through so we weren't waiting ages. It was still a bit of a wait though and Qype Captain Rob was going to pass out if he didn't get some food in him. But the pub itself is really pleasant - very airy, but manages not to be clinical at the same time. The little outside garden bit is cute too. I'm informed that pubs in Victoria are rubbish (this might be true as I only know of ever being to one in this area before.) so this pub was a nice surprise. Not too sure about the food though. Poor Rob looked so disappointed with his lentil salad and it did look a bit rubbish. I shared half of my chicken with him it looked that meagre. But I'm not entirely sure the chicken was cooked. It tasted cooked, but it looked so pink I was scared. The waitress insisted it was fine and then walked off. Nice. But in fairness, it did taste ok, and my potato salad had capers in which distracted me. I don't feel sick yet I'm not sure if we had the best experience the pub can offer. If we'd had a bit longer it might have been better, but unless I was in the area I wouldn't rush back. I also apologise to Rob if I've accidentally given him food poisoning.

a3iQUY_P7kkwipLpqfgQLw.text: I had a delicious risotto here along with a wonderful carrot soup. Prepare yourself - it's a bit noisy, but I liked the vibe!

l4Nn9htRwUxZ9gsfQfuBOw.text: This was a major disappointment. For some reason the room had an artic draft up to waist level to make sure that none us would fall asleep at the yawning list of unavailable items on the menu. We arrived at 9, late? Apparently so. "That is the last burger (really a burger?), that ïs the last fish, we have no more of the pasta special, or the vegetarian dish, and best of all, we have no more capers for the smoked salmon!" I should add an amount of smoked salmon that would have under served a newly born otter craving for his first sample of fish. Service was friendly but inexperienced. This brand of gastro's touts a model of decency that is not backed up.

l35or1Or4R8lSq267x24oQ.text: Now that's a tasty burger. Great pub, great atmosphere, great food. 'Nuff said.

fF6lSLomuPZtR120f5DpqQ.text: A great little pub in an area that is lacking them. There is a decent selection of cask ales and the food looks pretty suitable also. Having just moved my work to the area I will no doubt visit this place on a few occasions. A small beer garden and what seems to be a bit of a sun trap...looking forward to the hotter days in just a couple of months.

Q90IuUL7xDDWia2wtD0lwA.text: Fifth time here within two weeks as we're staying nearby. Nice easy local bar with good beer.

eCeG6NqInVNxGksrDWxwZQ.text: Great fish and chips, good beer selection, friendly staff, and great atmosphere!  We were staying just down the block at the Nadler and were too tired to walk far for dinner.  We choose The Phoenix because it was close and looked nice from the outside.  Thankfully, the experience matched first impressions.

YFEDXusnMtOMtMNw5rQ1tw.text: Lovely Gastropub! My sister and I shared the Stout and Steak pie with creamy mash and carrots. Very delicious! A little pricey by American standards, but the atmosphere and good service was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. Stout and Steak pie with creamy mash and carrots

QlZApxcqKDXKlYNNCK3abA.text: Sunday beer and snack.  Interesting menu, great soup.  Not your typical British Pub, but open Sundays!!!!

ho0JI9F0hFoHnZ8pAtY_uQ.text: The Phoenix has been revamped in recent months, with its existing retro interior boosted by a much-improved beer list. But service is still poor, and it can take 20 minutes to finally get a drink.I haven't eaten here, so can't comment on the food. Instead, my experience of the Phoenix has been one of occasional venue for works drinks. And it's always been a consistent one. Firstly, it tends to get swamped by workers from the surrounding offices. That tends to mean standing room only. Perhaps more crucially though, it means it can take ages to get a drink.Recently my colleagues and I stopped by earlier in an attempt to beat the crowds. This we successfully did, but unfortunately the Phoenix had duly reduced the staff behind the bar, meaning service was just as slow. The quality of the service can be somewhat dopey too - on the same night I saw someone complaining that whiskey had been added to a drink instead of vodka, while on another night I had to yell to stop one of the bar staff from adding ice (??!!) to my stout.The Phoenix has improved its beer list, which is definitely an improvement from the Youngs-centric selection it had before. That, plus the pleasant interior just about secure it a 3 stars from me. The poor service prevents it from scoring any higher.

YtMh8WNoIm75jXv0lMmzcw.text: Great location few blocks off the tourist path makes it a great spot for lunch or a drink. Simple but good menu. While not an official London pub, it's close enough for a tourist to enjoy.

SHjU4Kd2EYt2NZD-L8OlGg.text: Excellent little place for a warm meal with a great wine selection. My husband had the haddock fish and chips and I had the vegetarian pot pie with sweet potato. Both meals were served promptly, tasted great and were nice and hot. The spice in the pot pie is a curry base making it just the thing after a long flight from the States. The beer selection has a lot of options on draft and the wine menu has been carefully selected to ensure a great variety. Sit in the back for an intimate meal and try the cheese plate for dessert!

qNstS6I0iDY11w85LqFvrA.text: F*** this place. The bartender didn't know the beer I ordered which was visibly  on tap and I resorted to pointing to it like an idiot. He looked at me as though I was speaking gibberish. Paying took forever. And when I went to ask for a table to sit and eat I was first ignored by a pompous server, then judged as though I just wanted to sit and not eat, and then again ignored when I asked if I wasn't welcome. So we chugged our over priced beers outside and left. This area has so much more to offer than unfriendly staff and a small menu so don't wast your time or money.  We just moved near by and will not be back and tell everyone to avoid like the plague. The establishment and staff can get over themselves.

mUr1tZXVwl4Qwg9Divtr_w.text: Clean and warm friendly atmosphere. Relax before a show at St. James Theatre or grab a drink after work. Dinner is quick and delicious pub fare.

TzCe5kZJrJmzqAHyQ2uybQ.text: Yelpers, unfortunately, I cannot agree with the high ratings of this place!  The ambience was fine and service was good, but I promised my sister a good gastropub experience...and the food was not good. Most of the items were unavailable so we got the salmon, beef and vegetable stew.  All were really disapointing.  The beef was really bad -- barely edible and the waiter was nice enough to remove it from the bill but i really dont think i can come back remembering the fishy salmon, the wierd stew, and the unedible beef.

xohzS4z3kMcFh33B_Cr5Fw.text: Food was great service even better. Very helpful with suggestions and substitutions. Offered tasting of beers since we were unfamiliar!  Comments about noise?  It's a pub!  Hello!

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. Great time with wife on our 25th wedding anniversary!

sDGWSF_91g8M27zIxbUaTw.text: Feels like someones living room. The service was not great, but the food and ambiance made up for it. Very good Sunday roast.

kvro6hP4NT1co5lLsr3lCQ.text: A nice way to end a trip to the palace! Took my mom here for lunch after we finished a trip to the State Rooms. The decor is charming, the food (we both got the fish and chips) was good and the service was friendly and attentive.I would recommend this place to friends and family in the future and will likely be heading back!

KUFwHpQF7lGeqGZSM7eMgg.text: This was a nice pub one Saturday afternoon to grab a pint of London ale and get a nice portion of fish-n-chips.  They open at 12:30 PM.I admit I had to look at the menu to see what the green stuff was that I was eating.  It was mushed peas.  Us yanks don't get that side dish often in the states.  In fact, I don't think I've ever had it before.  We don't get our beer served at room temperature either but the London ale wasn't bad at all.  I wouldn't hesitate to order it next time.Inside there is a huge bar, some tables, and a nice small patio outside in the back.  Like the others have said, it's location is nice because it's a short walk from Buckingham Palace, but you probably wouldn't find it unless someone told you about it.I can't give 'em 5 stars because after waiting an eternity I had get up from my chair to ask for my check.  This was after my waitress pulled a disappearing act.  It's not a big deal, maybe she thought I was going to spend the rest of the afternoon and evening there.  It's nice, but it ain't that nice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. Fish N Chips
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom

8RjGFvl8nJTxiS9Vmzurug.text: While on a recent vacation to England I found myself in this establishment twice.  Once for lunch and again for drinks.  This place is just around the corner from Buckingham tucked down a side street.  The lunch was nice, they were offering a soup/entree/dessert meal and I went with that.  After ordering I inquired to what "Pimms" was.  Our server joked that not having ever tried or heard of Pimms was disgraceful.  This was a challenge I was willing to take on; it didnt happen at The Phoenix but I did have my Pimms.  The pasta was great, made me wish I had just ordered a whole plate of the stuff.  The soup was a bit disappointing, maybe I'm just not a fan of cold leek and potato soup.  The dessert seemed superfluous. Three nights later we were looking for a place to drop in and have a pint.  The place was just over half full.  The lone tv downstairs was showing something really boring so I asked if I could have it changed to the replay of the Lions/Springboks 2nd test that had played earlier that day.  Much to my delight they complied.   About two hours later the staff rang a bell to signify that it was closing time.  In the US the bell usually means last call for alcohol, but who were we to argue.

o4Ltjga6RkXO9TSUbKCb1g.text: Ah the Phoenix.A is a clean, well-lighted place to drink.It has the most random back garden.It's a burst of wildflowers in the brownfield urban wasteland of "Noice" pubs in Victoria shaking tourists for pound coins.Solid food, decent wines, great rotating ales, freindly staff.A nice place to drink.In Victoria.Who'd-a-thought it?

gRyAfr7qctSt7W7WOIn3Xw.text: Pretentious. In a word. Expensive. In two words.

2AQ2ufzK_pEH0kIPmSFb3g.text: I went to The Phoenix a few times during my last London visit. The food seems fairly hit or miss here, but I can tell you that I LOVED the mushroom wellington and the cheese and pickle sandwich was pretty good too. It's often crowded, though, and I hate it when there's a 10 or 15 pound minimum on credit cards. I get 5 pounds, but 10, really? What if I just want a sandwich for lunch? It's already a little overpriced for what it is. I think the best time I had here was when I just went for drinks and paid in cash - no food or anything to let me down.

UMxN8W1-ABcGmqgqGVFgyw.text: Had drinks with friends after work this evening, nice atmosphere, great staff and good selection if beer

s9x0GXw322jTpAFPPticQQ.text: It makes me sad to write this review! I have eaten here many times on my business trips to London and always found the food amazing; duck breast with a berry reduction, pork chops, and the most wonderful savory pies in the winter! Recently my wife and I returned to find the menu has changed as they have a new chef. Many of the items we liked so much are no longer on the menu. And many of the chalkboard specials were not available! Needless to say we were disappointed. I will give it a few months and try it again and hope that things improve!

lBU8oK4j3b5A46vqQJny2A.text: Great vibe! Friendly, attentive staff and nice to hang both inside and out.  Burger and a beer!

7WDSu6sZ7yP3azm9vXGDbA.text: This was probably the only meal I regret in London. I would've been better off going to the Marks and Spencer food halls and getting something to go. I had spinach and mushroom Wellington. No seasoning under cooked vegetables just not good at all.very nice servers but food needs some work.

XcUBPSlMDsriLZie7ch_uQ.text: I was really looking forward to a nice Sunday dinner here; the atmosphere was warm and convivial, the beer was excellent, and the service better than I expected in such a popular pub. Regrettably, the roast chicken I ordered was absurdly dry, notwithstanding the delicious gravy. The duck fat potatoes were a true highlight, and the Yorkshire puddings could not be improved. All in all, avoid the chicken, and enjoy the other wonderful aspects of a wonderful pub.

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. The scrumptious rhubarb crumble with creme anglaise.
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. Roast chicken with Yorkshire pudding and duck fat potatoes.
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. A delicious cask-strength bitter.

WD1SLU9wRZOuMlvvLsTYSg.text: Just around the corner from where I was working for the day and had dropped in for a drink a few months back.  I didn't get a chance to eat here but there was a bustling trade on food.They have a good beer selection with some cask ale offering and craft beer on tap.  Staff very friendly and service was also good.Worth a stop if you are in the area and its close to the Palace and Victoria station etc.

fgzEBvDWK_Gz8KVbW1JWww.text: Nice dinner of mushroom goat cheese tart with warm kale salad and fries. The upstairs is quieter and more relaxed than down. Sit near the window for a nice view. Friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom goat cheese tart with warm kale salad and fries

k88SLtESrQTRo5rNu3lc7g.text: This place is a little gem right near the Buckingham Palace.  If you need lunch, drinks and London gastropub experience, stop by and try their traditional dishes.  Service is wonderful for this modern pub.  We were here 5 years ago and had to come back again this time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom

9q_uHjdSxexpOBCCCLZ71g.text: Great pub near Victoria. Eclectic decor strikes the right mix of hip/cool. Lovely open fire. Can get crowded/noisy. Decent wine list & pub grub. Ideal after a walk across the park. Best seats are on the sofa next the fire.

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom

s-r4rKFZ2SZGie2u3M-fRg.text: We found this place after a cop at Buckingham palace recommended it. We are so grateful that he did! Two out of three of us order the cheeseburger with fries. This hands-down was the best burger I have ever eaten. Every part of the burger was delightful from the bread to the cheese which tasted like your cream. I don't think I've ever finished an entire burger in one sitting, will this one I did! The ambience reminds me of a French coffee shop, or old-school home converted into a restaurant. If ever I am in London again I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom

hXSyWSV57LI5QIsDkibzGg.text: One of the best hamburgers I've ever had, went well with the pint of London Lager I ordered.  Went around 5:30pm on a Thursday... it was packed with after work customers drinking beer.  The dining room is at the back.  The waitress asked 4 people who were only drinking at their table to vacate so I could sit (that's their rule).  The pub is located very close to Buckingham Palace.  The Queen wasn't there that evening.

Mv5K-lIAtl9sMyTtZwW0wA.text: Chicken and ham pie is a must here! Great place with an awesome atmosphere. Spacious pub with a friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and ham pie

1m46tDGapSsDJXfcz064Bw.text: Great food, warm ambiance, friendly service, good location, decent beer selection. I eat here every time I visit London. Enjoy!

2qRdT_aNrsjAQ97r4LIVbg.text: Very loud pub with young drunk crowd. Bartenders ignored anyone of 30 . Seems like a primary place to get really shitfaced. The upstairs is for dining and seemed far quieter.

b2LZCYCYeIZql17-RUKAOQ.text: What a shame!The place is very nice. Central, right round the corner from Buckingham palace, near to everything.But come on people! It is easter monday and tourists are around!No burgers at all!A super tiny menu.Every course was with lamb (none in my family eats lamb)If you want something that is not lamb there is a vegetarian pie, some starters and an hamburger...but sadly no hamburger for us today as they had finished them already as it is Monday. WTF?Very bad!At leas the beer we took was nice...I don't think i will go there again to give them another chance! It has been so disappointing!If you want to grab a beer is fine but for having a lunch i am sorry but is not.Hope you will enjoy the place more than i did!

eoZvlSqhTJadSgpXm5_rbA.text: Service was great. Everyone so courteous.This was our first meal in the UK.I have to say, it was very middle of the road food, what you would expect in the states for a 3 star place.I think I had better fish and chips in the California for much less.Our meal came at around 30 pounds or $45. It's a lot. We passed by this place many times during our stay and in the evenings it has  a lot of people hanging out!  I would definitely say it is not a must-see if you're visiting.

OL0AFlSY-PRDual9fl0bWw.text: The Phoenix was recommended by the concierge at our hotel for lunch. It did not disappoint. The waitress was awesome, the food was very good , the beer was great and the atmosphere was very good. I would recommend The Phoenix.

K-dIkgaDwggIsTmC-Av3jQ.text: Standard pub but with decent food and a good amount of space.Food: 3.5, Service: 4, Atmosphere: 4Return worthiness: sureEve award: best pubified fried cauliflower Highlights:- Cauliflower: surprise highlight in the sampler platter being deep fried to browned perfection. Delicious. It impersonates a chicken wing in form so I found that entertaining.- Cheese and bacon wedges: just like you'd expect for satisfying pub food but the quality version- Menu: more than just the standard fish and chips. Many items sounded pretty good and a bit fancified.- Bartenders: friendly and not hard to get their attention. Evelyn rules :-)- Decent selection of items outside of beer: liquor, wine, etc- Roomy: lots of space up top and nice booths for our group up frontMidlights:- Mac and cheese: not amazing but not bad. Served in a small ramekin.Lowlights:- Nachos: big flour chips like what you would find as a shell in a taco salad so very greasy- Closes early: like most pubs, they shoo you out at 11pmHad a good time here with my friends a few times during our visit.

a4BAUDHIUBXEqpN9hy7v5g.text: Really just ok. Pretty underwhelming after going to many great local spots. Good looking place I suppose.

hWCdvzg6zE55d0YEgZlNqA.text: Went here for a few pints on a Thursday night. Sadly, the beers were as flat as tap water. We tried a few different types too - all absolutely flat. Bar staff offered us another - but what is the point if they're all as flat as each other? Avoid this, there's a dozen other pubs within a few minutes walk. They've recently refurbished the place and it looks great too, so shame about the drinks.

7WZfIKExe0TaoRMBpgEADg.text: Went there for after work drinks with the team. The storage is beautiful - I loved the burlesque wall paper. Quote crowded and not the best crowd but hey its a pub.

XdoUgK7lI07reJ4RtVujPw.text: If you love pub food, this place takes the concept to a whole new level! My tastebuds have been spoiled for life. I love this place - no, I LOVE THIS PLACE!

photos.caption: Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. No shortage of beer and wine at The Phoenix!
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. If you look up the meaning of fish and chips in the dictionary, you will find this picture. Quintessentially fish&chips
Photo of The Phoenix - London, United Kingdom. The Phoenix on Palace Rd- my new favourite pub in London.
